definition: to be thoroughly discredited/to fall into disrepute
name/noun (part of speech)/place (e.g. among winners)/famous/classifier for people
to praise/to acclaim/reputation
to sweep
broom
earth/ground/field/place/land/CL:片[pian4]
-ly/structural particle: used before a verb or adjective, linking it to preceding modifying adverbial adjunct

sentences.english: Because of the scandal the school has fallen into disrepute.
sentences.chinese: 丑闻使这所学校名誉扫地。

sentences.english: The politician became bankrupt in reputation.
The reputation and future of a 19-year-old girl is on tenterhooks.
sentences.chinese: 一个只有19岁的女孩似乎就此名誉扫地。

sentences.english: She has described him as politically discredited.
sentences.chinese: 勒庞形容他政治名誉扫地。

definition: to lose one's standing/to have one's reputation swept away/a complete defeat and fall from grace
lit. for one's face to reach rock bottom/to be thoroughly discredited (idiom)
stinking reputation/notorious far and wide
to be shamed/to be humiliated
to have a bad reputation
lit. target of a multitude of arrows (idiom); the butt of public criticism/attacked on all sides
scandal
lit. wind and rain sweeping through the town (idiom)/fig. a big scandal/an uproar/the talk of the town
(of a plot etc) to be exposed (idiom)/to come to light
to lose every scrap of reputation
lit. to drop a thousand zhang in one fall (idiom)/fig. (of business, popularity etc) to suffer a sudden, devastating decline/to take a dive
lit. people rebelling and friends deserting (idiom)/fig. to find oneself utterly isolated
to spit on and curse/to revile
a matter for ridicule/an object of ridicule/laughingstock
lit. to get shackled and thrown in jail (idiom)/fig. to be put behind bars/to get jailed
sb condemned by history (idiom)
